title: Job Openings at IOTA Group
content:
IOTA Group was founded in 1982, by the entrepreneur Jean-Claude CUSIN and stands today as a leading International Independent Energy Consultant Services Firm. Ever since its inception, this initial entrepreneurial state of mind has never stopped being the essence of IOTA’s approach to business success and true long-term value creation for its Customers.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Drilling Contract & Procurement Engineer (Expat)

Job Location: Lagos

Job Description
     

            
    




	We are seeking a detail-oriented and analytical Drilling Contract & Procurement Engineer to join our team in Lagos, Nigeria.
	This expatriate position offers an exciting opportunity to leverage your expertise in drilling operations, contract management, and procurement processes within the oil and gas industry.
	Manage all aspects of drilling contracts, including drafting, negotiation, and administration
	Develop and implement procurement strategies for drilling equipment, materials, and services
	Conduct thorough cost analyses and risk assessments for drilling projects
	Negotiate with vendors and suppliers to ensure optimal terms and conditions
	Oversee the tender process for drilling-related contracts
	Collaborate with cross-functional teams to align procurement activities with project timelines
	Monitor contract performance and ensure compliance with terms and conditions
	Implement and maintain procurement software systems
	Develop and maintain relationships with key stakeholders, including vendors and internal departments
	Stay updated on industry trends, regulations, and best practices in drilling contract management and procurement


Qualifications


	Bachelor's degree in Engineering, preferably Petroleum Engineering
	5-7 years of experience in drilling contract management and procurement
	Professional certification in Contract Management or Procurement (e.g., CPSM, CPM)
	Extensive knowledge of drilling operations and the oil and gas industry
	Strong understanding of international contract law and procurement processes
	Proven experience in negotiation, risk assessment, and cost analysis
	Proficiency in procurement software and project management tools
	Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
	Strong communication and interpersonal skills
	Ability to work effectively in a multicultural environment
	Willingness to work as an expatriate in Lagos, Nigeria
	International experience in the oil and gas industry is highly preferred.


Click here to apply online

 

2.) Geotechnical Engineer

Job Location: Lagos

Job Description


	We are seeking an experienced Geotechnical Engineer to join our field execution team for advanced geotechnical and foundation engineering works.
	The ideal candidate will bring hands-on experience in implementing a wide range of soil improvement techniques such as Perforated Vertical Drains (PVDs), Dynamic Soil Improvement, Deep Soil Mixing (DSM), Jet Grouting, Sheet Piling, Anchors, Interlocking Contiguous Tubular Steel Piles and Combi Wall.
	This role is focused on execution and site supervision, not just design, but requires the ability to read and understand engineering drawings and technical specifications to ensure successful implementation in the field.


Key Responsibilities


	Supervise and ensure proper field execution techniques including:
	
		Perforated Vertical Drains (PVDs)
		Dynamic Compaction and Soil Improvement 
		Deep Soil Mixing (DSM)
		Jet Grouting
		Sheet Piling 
		Tie Rods Anchors
		Combi Wall Revetments
		Interlocking Contiguous Tubular Steel Piles.
	
	
	Interpret and follow geotechnical design documents, construction drawings, and method statements.
	Coordinate with and monitor the soil laboratory team to ensure accurate execution of field and laboratory tests.
	Be proficient in interpretation of Cone Penetration Tests (CPT) and Standard Penetration Tests (SPT).
	Monitor and document daily site activities to ensure quality, safety, and compliance with technical specifications.
	Coordinate with contractors, subcontractors, and project teams to resolve field issues in real time.
	Ensure accurate record-keeping, progress reporting, and material tracking.
	Participate in technical meetings and provide input on constructability and execution optimization.


Qualifications


	Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Geotechnical Engineering, Civil Engineering, or related field.
	Minimum [5+] years of field-based experience in geotechnical and foundation works.
	Proven expertise in the execution (not just design) of soil improvement and deep foundation techniques.
	Strong experience in DSM, Jet Grouting, PVDs, Dynamic compaction, Sheet piles, Tie Rods, Combi Wall Revetments and Interlocking Contiguous Tubular Steel Piles.
	Knowledgeable in interpreting CPT and SPT results and coordinating related activities with the testing teams.
	Ability to read and understand design drawings, technical reports, and specifications.
	Must be able to speak, read, and write English fluently and accurately to communicate effectively with international teams and stakeholders.  
	Strong leadership, communication, and coordination skills for site operations.
	Familiarity with construction site safety procedures and QA/QC requirements.


Click here to apply online

 

3.) Senior Drilling Engineer 

Job Location: Lagos

Job Description


	We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior Drilling Engineer to join our team in Lagos, Nigeria.
	As a Senior Drilling Engineer, you will play a crucial role in planning, designing, and overseeing drilling operations for both offshore and onshore projects.


Responsibilities


	Develop and optimize drilling programs and well designs to ensure safe, efficient, and cost-effective operations
	Provide technical leadership and guidance to the drilling team throughout all phases of well construction
	Analyze and interpret geological and geophysical data to make informed decisions on drilling strategies
	Collaborate with multidisciplinary teams to address complex drilling challenges and implement innovative solutions
	Conduct risk assessments and develop contingency plans for potential drilling issues
	Monitor and evaluate drilling performance, recommending improvements to enhance efficiency and reduce non-productive time
	Ensure compliance with company policies, industry standards, and local regulations
	Prepare detailed technical reports and presentations for management and stakeholders
	Mentor and train junior drilling engineers to foster their professional development.


Qualifications


	Bachelor's Degree in Petroleum Engineering or a related field; Master's degree preferred
	Minimum of 8-10 years of experience in drilling engineering, including offshore and onshore operations
	Professional Engineering (PE) license or equivalent certification
	Languages : English and French an added value 
	Advanced knowledge of drilling engineering principles and practices
	Proficiency in drilling software and simulation tools
	Strong problem-solving and decision-making abilities
	Excellent project management skills
	Effective communication and interpersonal skills
	In-depth knowledge of drilling technologies and equipment
	Familiarity with industry standards and regulations
	Thorough understanding of well control and safety procedures
	Proven track record of successful well planning and execution
	Detail-oriented approach with strong analytical and organizational skills
	Ability to work efficiently in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
	Willingness to travel to various project sites as required.


Click here to apply online

Secretary to Chairman & Marketing Manager (Female) Job at Kingrock International Nigeria Limited




        
    

        
        Kingrock International Nigeria Limited, founded in 2012, is a leading player in Nigeria’s mining industry. Headquartered in Abuja, we specialize in the exploration, development, and processing of mineral resources across the country. With a strong commitment to sustainable practices, safety, and technological innovation, we have built a reputation for excellence and reliability in the sector. Our dynamic team and forward-thinking leadership continue to drive growth and expansion in both local and international markets.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Secretary to Chairman & Marketing Manager (Female)

Job Location: Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time
     

            
    



Key Responsibilities


	Manage executive scheduling, administrative operations, and cross-functional PR initiatives
	Oversee project lifecycles: Planning → Implementation → Monitoring → Reporting
	Serve as primary liaison for internal/external stakeholders with timely communication
	Conduct performance analysis and deliver executive briefings
	Coordinate high-level meetings and business engagements.


Qualifications & Attributes


	Educational background: Senior High School Diploma (minimum of a Bachelor’s degree from top-tier universities preferred)
	≤26 years old | Height ≥165cm
	Exceptional personal presence: Professional image, polished demeanor, and strong etiquette awareness
	Foundational qualities: Proactive mindset, cultural sensitivity, and grace under pressure
	Technical proficiency: Advanced computer literacy (MS Office Suite required; CRM tools a plus).


Core Requirements:
Professional Excellence:


	International corporate exposure (preferred)
	Business fluency in English (clear articulation) + Chinese proficiency (advantageous)
	Demonstrated business etiquette and personal brand consciousness.


Personal Attributes:


	Impeccable grooming and socially adept disposition
	Growth mindset with commitment to continuous improvement
	Unquestionable integrity and loyalty to organizational values.


Operational Competencies:


	Self-driven project execution with end-to-end ownership
	Leadership aptitude: Team coordination + conflict resolution
	Advanced writing skills for executive communications
	Strategic networking capabilities across cultures.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV with professional photo to: kaibonigeria@kaibogroup.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note


	Only female candidates will be considered per business requirements
	If you are interested, please contact Mr. Minat, 09112336051.

Sales Executive (Salary Loan / Wealth Management) Job at Rosabon Financial Services




        
    

        
        Rosabon Financial Services (RFS) Limited - Award winning Rosabon Financial Services is a member of the Concept Group. Licensed by the Central Bank of Nigeria, CBN on April 22, 1993 and being a long standing member of the Equipment Leasing Association of Nigeria (ELAN), the organization has evolved into Nigeria’s leading Non-Banking Financial Intermediary and Equipment Leasing firm focused on niche and general markets.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Sales Executive (Salary Loan / Wealth Management)

Job Location: Oyo
Employment Type: Full-time

Scope and Impact
     

            
    




	The candidate will be tasked with the responsibility of selling various loan products.
	He / She will act as liaison between customers and our financial institution and will help qualified applicants acquire loans in a timely manner.


Job Summary


	The Rosabon Sales Executive is required to collect and prepare all materials needed to process transactions (loans and investments).
	He/ She will also responsible for reviewing loan applications evaluating the potential risks of granting loans to applicants.


Duties and Responsibilities


	Evaluate credit worthiness by processing loan applications and documentation within specified limits
	Interview applicants to determine financial eligibility and feasibility of granting loans
	Determine all applicable ratios and metrics and set up debt payment plans
	Communicate with clients either to request or to provide information
	Justify decisions (approvals/rejections) and report on them
	Complete loan contracts and counsel clients on policies and restrictions
	Review loan agreements to ensure that they are complete and accurate according to policy
	Update account records, Compute payment schedules and transactions on ERP
	Confer with underwriters to aid in resolving loan application problems.
	Update job knowledge on types of loans and other financial services
	Assess customer needs, explore all options and introduce different types of loans
	Develop referral networks, suggest alternate channels and cross-sell products and services to accomplish quotas
	Go the “extra mile” to build trust relationships, customer loyalty and satisfaction throughout the underwriting process
	Operate in compliance with laws and regulations and adhere to lending compliance guidelines
	Deposit mobilization to meet set targets.


Key Performance Indicators


	Meet Set Monthly loan and investment Targets
	Reduced number of Non-Performing loans
	Customer retention rate of minimum 90% across loan and investment products.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess a B.Sc Degree in Finance, Economics or a related field
	Proven working experience as a Loan Officer
	Familiarity with computers and banking applications/software
	Solid understanding of direct/indirect lending products and practices
	Customer satisfaction orientation and sales competencies
	Ability to work in a goal oriented environment and meet set target.


Salary
N80,000 - N150,000 / Month.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their applications to: oluwafemi.adesanya@conceptgroup-ng.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
